  • Constructor Details

      public TextSteps()

  • Method Details

    • enterRandomText

      @When("^I randomly enter (.*) in the (.*)(?: for the (.*))$") public static void enterRandomText​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String storageName)
      Appends random text to the given text and enters this new text into a text box that matches the given elementName as defined on the Page object. The given element name is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores, then it is sent a sendKeys event to an element defined on a page object with that name. The page object and driver object are defined by the WebDriverFactory and PageFactory objects. The derived Page Object (extends Page) should define a method named [element name]_[element type] returning a PageElement object (e.g. password_field).

      Since this random value might need to be referenced again, we store it using the ConfigurationManager, using the passed elementname as the key to retrieve it.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I enter random User Name Bob in the username textbox
      • I enter random text in the Street Address field
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to enter into the element
      elementName - String the name of the element into which to enter text
      storageName - String an additional modifier for storing data

    • enterRandomText

      public static void enterRandomText​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String elementName)
      Overloaded method for entering random text in a text box, so that nulls do not need to be passed. Intended for use in creating complex Cucumber steps definitions.
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to enter into the element
      elementName - String the name of the element into which to enter text

    • enterText

      @When("^I enter (.*) in the (.*)$") public static void enterText​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String elementName)
      Enters the text into a text box that matches the given elementName as defined on the current Page object, and stores the text entered into the Configuration Manager using the element name as the key. The given elementName is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores, then it is sent a sendKeys event to an element defined on a page object with that name. The page object and driver object are defined by the WebDriverFactory and PageFactory objects. The derived Page Object (extends Page) should define a method named [element name]_[element type] returning a PageElement object (e.g. password_field).

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I enter bob in the username textbox
      • I enter abc123 in the Password field
      • I went test@test.com in the email field
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to enter into the element
      elementName - String the name of the element into which to enter text

    • injectText

      @When("^I inject (.*) in the (.*)$") public static void injectText​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String elementName)
      Enters the given text into a text box that matches the given elementName as defined on the current Page object, then stores the text value in the Configuration Manager using the given element name as the key. The given element name is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores in getElementAsTextbox, then it is sent a pressKeys event to an element defined on a page object with that name. The page object and driver object are defined by the WebDriverFactory and PageFactory objects. The derived Page Object (extends Page) should define a method named [element name]_[element type] returning a PageElement object (e.g. password_field).

      This is different from just entering text in that the text is injected into the element by executing javascript. This will deal with javascript sending key events to a hidden field for text processing when the sendKeys() method isn't working.

      NOTE: This should only be used if the standard "I enter <text> in the <element> step does not work. It is not representative of typical user action.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I inject bob in the username textbox
      • I inject abc123 in the Password field
      • I inject test@test.com into the email field
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to enter
      elementName - String the name of the element into which to enter text

    • enterStoredText

      @When("^I reuse the (.*) text in the (.*)$") public static void enterStoredText​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String elementName)
      Types the randomly generated text for the given key under which the text is stored in the given elementName. The given values can have the same name as it looks up a stored value for that element. This should be called only after using the method i_enter_random_text_in_the_textbox_named(). It then types that value into the element using sendKeys(). This step will work across steps and tests by using dependency injection (DI).

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I reuse the email text in the email field
      • I reuse the password text in the password field
      • I reuse the username text in the username field.
      Parameters:
      key - String the key used to retrieve the value
      elementName - String the name of the element into which to enter text

    • keyPress

      @When("^I press the (escape|enter|return|tab) key$") public static void keyPress​(java.lang.String keyName)
      Sends a key press event for a special key: ESCAPE, ENTER, RETURN, or TAB.
      Parameters:
      keyName -

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I press the escape key
      • I press the enter key
      • I press the tab key
